definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: Mr Osborne himself reputedly pushed for Mr Clarke's appointment.
sentences.chinese: 據說奧斯本本人曾大力舉薦克拉克。

sentences.english: Black Cohosh is widely recommended by European doctors for menopause.
sentences.chinese: 黑升麻普遍舉薦對更年期歐洲的年夜夫。

sentences.english: I hope you’ll find he is just as good as I’m now recommendinghim to be.
sentences.chinese: 我希望您會發現他正如我所舉薦他的那樣好。

sentences.english: Knowing Liu-xia Hui's worth, he would not give him a position.
sentences.chinese: 他知道柳下惠有才能卻不能舉薦他在朝廷任職。

sentences.english: The girl should be recommended for her bravery in saving the child.
sentences.chinese: 那個姑娘勇救兒童而應受舉薦。

sentences.english: I want to recomnend this book to you .
sentences.chinese: 我想把這本書舉薦給你們讀一下。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
